title: Continuance or Reestablishment of Certain Federal Advisory Committees and Amendments to Other Executive Orders

enrichment.summary: This executive order extends or renews a wide range of federal advisory committees until September 30, 2023, and updates the responsibilities and structure of certain committees, especially those related to national security and health. It also amends some earlier executive orders to refine committee functions and leadership terms. The order delegates oversight duties to relevant departments and agencies to ensure continued advice and guidance on diverse policy areas.
potential_concerns: The updated structure and responsibilities of advisory committees related to cybersecurity-national-security may increase demands on cybersecurity professionals without providing adequate support or resources.
Environmental justice communities might experience delays in policy advocacy or diminished direct influence if committee roles are not sufficiently inclusive or responsive to their needs.

Individuals with disabilities and those with mental health conditions could be underrepresented in advisory committees, limiting the effectiveness of related public-health-emergency-response policies.
Delegation of oversight to department heads may reduce transparency and public accountability, potentially marginalizing the voices of vulnerable populations represented by these advisory committees.
